Package resource

Class ResourceManager

java.lang.Object
resource.ResourceManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer, IResourceManager
public class ResourceManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IResourceManager
Implementation of IResourceManager. Use Observer design pattern obtain notifications of the failures. De-registers worker process on receiving the failure notification. Follows a bounded resource approach and allocates workerIds from a fixed pool. Uses ProcessBuilder for building the worker.
Author:
somilgupta

  • Constructor Details

    • ResourceManager

      public ResourceManager​(int capacity, java.lang.String classpath, java.lang.String workerApplicationName, IHeartBeatManager heartBeatManager)
      Manages the resources (workers) for the master in a bounded fashion. Uses processes to represent workers.
      Parameters:
      capacity - Maximum number of workers. Throws CapacityFullException if the capacity is exceeded.
      workerApplicationName - Name of the worker application in the given classPath. Throws WorkerInstantiationException if the process build fails.
      classpath - Folder where the application would be found. Please note that this should be the location of class file and not the source file.
      heartBeatManager - Implementation of IHeartBeatManager which would be called for maintaining heartbeat for new or killed workers.

  • Method Details

    • createWorker

      public void createWorker()
      Description copied from interface: IResourceManager
      Create worker process and register it. Master must notify the worker of its workerId which it would use in future communications with the task allocation server.
      Specified by:
      createWorker in interface IResourceManager

    • stopWorker

      public void stopWorker​(int workerId)
      Description copied from interface: IResourceManager
      Stop the worker process with the given worker Id. This should also close the heartbeat client for that worker before killing the process to prevent redundant failure notifications.
      Specified by:
      stopWorker in interface IResourceManager
      Parameters:
      workerId - Id of the worker to be stopped.

    • stopAllWorkers

      public void stopAllWorkers()
      Description copied from interface: IResourceManager
      Stop all the workers currently active. This function should implicity call {IResourceManager.stopWorker(int)} to kill the workers. Called by task allocator when all the tasks are completed to kill the workers waiting for tasks.
      Specified by:
      stopAllWorkers in interface IResourceManager

    • getActiveWorkers

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Process> getActiveWorkers()
      Description copied from interface: IResourceManager
      Obtain all the workers active at this moment. This list may be transitory and additional check must be employed before using this as a process may have died after receiving this list.
      Specified by:
      getActiveWorkers in interface IResourceManager
      Returns:
      Map of workerIds to Process for active workers.

    • update

      public void update​(java.util.Observable o, java.lang.Object arg)
      Specified by:
      update in interface java.util.Observer
